title: Can we talk abotu how useless blinds are?
body:
The entire mechanic is kinda worthless at the moment, no blidn i know of in game lasts more then 2 seconds, and almsot all ADC's can jsut dash or use an ability during that time, and the few champions who DO heavily rely on autos typically dont care if they are blinded for 1-2 seconds.  And not only that, but SOME, but not all, auto based abilities ignore the rules of blind anyways.  for example, nasus's Q half ignore blind as his Q is consumed, but no damage is dealt.  meanwhile vaynes Q DOES do the damage is suppsoed to do, compeltley ignoring the blind.

I think the "blind" mechanic shoudl be reworked into somethign more along the lines of anythign that requires a target will "miss" for the duration, since you have ot aim, and being blind means you cant see.  Meanwhile skillshots woudl still hit since they are essencially being thrown out in a general diretion without being targeted at anything specific.  Seems kinda pointless to have a mechanic that only stops one specific type of damage in game that very few champions actually HAVE to rely on anymore.

i mean think about it

if you could incompacitate any champion for 3 seconds that'd be broken.  It's exactly why they nerfed the taunt/fear on ramass and fiddle

We already have champions who can incapacitate some champions for 3 seconds in {{champion:25}} and{{champion:90}}. I think that this kind of change to blinds would not incapacitate champions nearly as hard as even a silence or snare for half that duration would, let alone a harder form of CC like a stun, knockup, etc.

The thing with those two however is that even if Morgana binds you, you can still take action and relies on your team following up, and Malzahar's ult essentially cc's him as well, so that's a game of which team jumps on who first. A blind however would take an ad carry and even some ad casters out of fights completely for a duration with little cost, similar to how silences take mages and most assassins out of fights completely for a duration.

I'm not talking about Malzahar's ultimate here. I'm talking about Malzahar's 3 second silence, which will take anyone that isn't an ADC out of a fight almost completely for a duration with, again, with little cost.

Morgana's 3 second snare will also take a large majority of melee champions out of a fight with, once again, little cost.

There's really no comparison.
They're also both fairly slow moving skill shots, and Malz's Q especially has a noticeable delay. You can't dodge a Teemo blind.

We are tlakign about a skill that currently does nothing, at all, to 99% of the champions in game, and the 1% it DOES hurt it only hurts for about 2 autos, which i will remind you again, can be easily ignored by using an ability during that time.  so whats the harm of letting you miss 1 targeted ability?  its no worse then spellshielding an ability, or using a heal mid combat, or vayne in general.

and they have been slowly phasing silences out of the game.

Only targetted silences. Kassadin's, LeBlanc's, and Talon's targetted silences were all removed because they were genuinely unhealthy for the game, and Viktor's silence technically wasn't too far off (although he got some sweet buffs to compensate at the time).

We had more silences phased out of the game because those silences were unhealthy, but we still have more than twice as many silences as we have blinds.

The issue with blinds is the same issue with say Poppy, any buffs or changes could result in it becoming incredibly overbearing. Right now the only 2 champs who have it are Quinn and Teemo; Teemo's blind is decently useful as it's 2.5 seconds and targeted, while Quinns is shorter and a skillshot but also aoe. Teemo needs it for lane bullying and since he's shit in 1v1's unless super ahead, while Quinn needs it to stand toe to toe with bruisers while splitpushing. If blinds became more common/reliable then ad champions would have a hell of a time since even ad casters weave autos in here and there.

Blind it to Auto Attackers what Silence is to Spell Casters.
